alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Cook; Lanier; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:08PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cook, southeastern Berrien, Lanier and northern Lowndes Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 708 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ray City to near Moody Air Force Base to near Valdosta. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lakeland, Valdosta, Hahira, Ray City, Moody Air Force Base, Meigs, Cecil, Naylor, Courthouse, Greenwood, Barretts, New Lois, Hansell, I-75 At Exit 29, I-75 At Exit 22, Stockton and Teeterville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
